title: Buena Vista Social Club
plot: A group of legendary Cuban musicians, some as old as their nineties, were brought together by Ry Cooder to record a CD. In this film, we see and hear some of the songs being recorded in Havana. There is also footage from concerts in Amsterdam and New York City's Carnegie Hall. In addition, many of the individual musicians talk about their lives in Cuba and about how they got started in music.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 20 wins & 10 nominations.
stars: Compay Segundo, Ibrahim Ferrer, Rubén González, Octavio Calderon

plotShort.plainText:
Buena Vista Social Club (film)
Buena Vista Social Club is a 1999 documentary film directed by Wim Wenders about the music of Cuba. It is named for a danzón that became the title piece of the album Buena Vista Social Club. The film is an international co-production of Germany, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Cuba.
plotShort.html:
Buena Vista Social Club (film)

Buena Vista Social Club is a 1999 documentary film directed by Wim Wenders about the music of Cuba. It is named for a danzón that became the title piece of the album Buena Vista Social Club. The film is an international co-production of Germany, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Cuba.

plotFull.plainText:
Buena Vista Social Club (film)
Buena Vista Social Club is a 1999 documentary film directed by Wim Wenders about the music of Cuba. It is named for a danzón that became the title piece of the album Buena Vista Social Club. The film is an international co-production of Germany, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Cuba.
Content
The film documents how Ry Cooder, long-time friend of Wenders, brought together the ensemble of legendary Cuban musicians to record an album (also called Buena Vista Social Club) and to perform two times with a full line-up: in April 1998 in Amsterdam (two nights) and the 1st of July 1998 in the United States (at the Carnegie Hall, New York City). Although they are geographically close, travel between Cuba and the United States is restricted due to the political tension between the two countries, so many of the artists were travelling there for the first time. The film shows their reactions to this experience, as well as including footage of the resultant sell-out concert. It also includes interviews with each of the main performers.
Musicians
Francisco Repilado, aka Compay Segundo (vocals and tres)
Eliades Ochoa (vocals and guitar)
Ry Cooder (slide guitar)
Joachim Cooder, Ry's son (percussion)
Ibrahim Ferrer (vocals, congas, claves, bongos)
Omara Portuondo (vocals)
Rubén González (piano)
Orlando "Cachaito" López (Double bass)
Amadito Valdés
Manuel "Guajiro" Mirabal (trumpet)
Barbarito Torres (laúd)
Pío Leyva
Manuel "Puntillita" Licea (vocals)
Juan de Marcos González (güiro)
Release
Critical reception
Buena Vista Social Club received critical acclaim. On Rotten Tomatoes, the film has a 91% "Certified Fresh" score based on 44 reviews, with an average rating of 7.5/10. Metacritic reports an 81 out of 100 rating based on 19 critics, indicating "universal acclaim".
Accolades
The film was nominated for an Academy Award for best documentary feature in 2000. It won as best documentary in the European Film Awards as well as many others. The album Buena Vista Social Club features studio versions of the music heard in the film.
Influence
The film helped the musicians, some of them already in their nineties, become known to a worldwide audience, with some going on to release popular solo albums. These included Ibrahim Ferrer, Compay Segundo, Rubén González and Elíades Ochoa. The latter went on to support younger musicians making the same style of music beyond 2010 under the name "Buena Vista Social Club".
plotFull.html:
Buena Vista Social Club (film)

Buena Vista Social Club is a 1999 documentary film directed by Wim Wenders about the music of Cuba. It is named for a danzón that became the title piece of the album Buena Vista Social Club. The film is an international co-production of Germany, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Cuba.


Content

The film documents how Ry Cooder, long-time friend of Wenders, brought together the ensemble of legendary Cuban musicians to record an album (also called Buena Vista Social Club) and to perform two times with a full line-up: in April 1998 in Amsterdam (two nights) and the 1st of July 1998 in the United States (at the Carnegie Hall, New York City). Although they are geographically close, travel between Cuba and the United States is restricted due to the political tension between the two countries, so many of the artists were travelling there for the first time. The film shows their reactions to this experience, as well as including footage of the resultant sell-out concert. It also includes interviews with each of the main performers.


Musicians

  • Francisco Repilado, aka Compay Segundo (vocals and tres)
  • Eliades Ochoa (vocals and guitar)
  • Ry Cooder (slide guitar)
  • Joachim Cooder, Ry's son (percussion)
  • Ibrahim Ferrer (vocals, congas, claves, bongos)
  • Omara Portuondo (vocals)
  • Rubén González (piano)
  • Orlando "Cachaito" López (Double bass)
  • Amadito Valdés
  • Manuel "Guajiro" Mirabal (trumpet)
  • Barbarito Torres (laúd)
  • Pío Leyva
  • Manuel "Puntillita" Licea (vocals)
  • Juan de Marcos González (güiro)

Release

Critical reception

Buena Vista Social Club received critical acclaim. On Rotten Tomatoes, the film has a 91% "Certified Fresh" score based on 44 reviews, with an average rating of 7.5/10. Metacritic reports an 81 out of 100 rating based on 19 critics, indicating "universal acclaim".

Accolades

The film was nominated for an Academy Award for best documentary feature in 2000. It won as best documentary in the European Film Awards as well as many others. The album Buena Vista Social Club features studio versions of the music heard in the film.


Influence

The film helped the musicians, some of them already in their nineties, become known to a worldwide audience, with some going on to release popular solo albums. These included Ibrahim Ferrer, Compay Segundo, Rubén González and Elíades Ochoa. The latter went on to support younger musicians making the same style of music beyond 2010 under the name "Buena Vista Social Club".

tagline: Cubas Poesie Cubas Musik, Cubas Menschen, Cubas Poesie [The music of Cuba, the people of Cuba, the poetry of Cuba]

similars.title: Pina
similars.plot: A tribute to the late German choreographer, Pina Bausch, as her dancers perform her most famous creations.
similars.stars: Pina Bausch, Regina Advento, Malou Airaudo

similars.title: Buena Vista Social Club: Adios
similars.plot: Revisit with the remaining original members of the Buena Vista Social Club and explore their contribution to the unknown history of Cuba.
similars.stars: Ibrahim Ferrer, Omara Portuondo, Eliades Ochoa

similars.title: The Salt of the Earth
similars.plot: The life and work of photographer Sebastião Salgado, who has spent forty years documenting deprived societies in hidden corners of the world.
similars.directors: Directors: Juliano Ribeiro Salgado, Wim Wenders
similars.stars: Sebastião Salgado, Wim Wenders, Lélia Wanick Salgado

similars.title: Land of Plenty
similars.plot: A drama that investigates anxiety and disillusionment in America.
similars.stars: Michelle Williams, John Diehl, Wendell Pierce

similars.title: Palermo Shooting
similars.plot: After the wild life-style of a famous young German photographer almost gets him killed, he goes to Palermo, Sicily to take a break. Can the beautiful city and a beautiful local woman help him calm himself down?

similars.title: Don't Come Knocking
similars.plot: An aging cowboy movie star deserts a film set and tries to reconnect with his mother, whom he hasn't seen in thirty years, only to learn that he has a child he never knew about.
similars.stars: Sam Shepard, Jessica Lange, Tim Roth

similars.title: Lisbon Story
similars.plot: The director Friedrich Monroe has trouble with finishing a silent b&w movie about Lisbon. He calls his friend, the sound engineer Phillip Winter, for help. As Winter arrives Lisbon weeks ... See full summary »
similars.stars: Rüdiger Vogler, Patrick Bauchau, Vasco Sequeira

similars.title: Tokyo-Ga
similars.plot: Moved by the work of director Yasujirô Ozu, Wim Wenders travels to Japan in search of the Tokyo seen in Ozu's films.
similars.stars: Chishû Ryû, Werner Herzog, Yûharu Atsuta

similars.title: Invisibles
similars.plot: A series of short films examining the world's overlooked problems and the people who suffer from them.
similars.directors: Directors: Mariano Barroso, Isabel Coixet, and 3 more credits »

similars.title: The Soul of a Man
similars.plot: The dramatic tension in the blues between the sacred and the profane by exploring the music and lives of three of director Wim Wenders's favorite blues artists.
similars.stars: Chris Thomas King, Keith B. Brown, James Hughes

similars.title: Faraway, So Close!
similars.plot: A group of angels in the German capital look longingly upon the life of humans.
similars.stars: Otto Sander, Bruno Ganz, Peter Falk

similars.title: Pope Francis: A Man of His Word
similars.fullTitle: Pope Francis: A Man of His Word (2018)
similars.plot: Pope Francis travels the world speaking to those in need and delivering a message of hope.
similars.stars: Pope Francis, Ignazio Oliva, Sister María Eufemia Goycoechea
